name: B. T-shirt buying
statement:
A new pack of t-shirts came to a shop. Each of the t-shirts is
characterized by three integers , and , where is the price of the -th
t-shirt, is front color of the -th t-shirt and is back color of the -th
t-shirt. All values are distinct, and values and are integers from to .
buyers will come to the shop. Each of them wants to buy exactly one
t-shirt. For the -th buyer we know his favorite color .A buyer agrees to
buy a t-shirt, if at least one side (front or back) is painted in his
favorite color. Among all t-shirts that have colors acceptable to this
buyer he will choose the cheapest one. If there are no such t-shirts,
the buyer won’t buy anything. Assume that the buyers come one by one,
and each buyer is served only after the previous one is served.You are
to compute the prices each buyer will pay for t-shirts.
